project.name: pixi.js
project.description: Pixi.js is a fast lightweight 2D library that works across all devices.

Circle.name: Circle
Circle.description: The Circle object can be used to specify a hit area for displayObjects

params.name: x
params.description: The X coord of the upper-left corner of the framing rectangle of this circle

params.name: y
params.description: The Y coord of the upper-left corner of the framing rectangle of this circle

params.name: radius
params.description: The radius of the circle

Ellipse.name: Ellipse
Ellipse.description: The Ellipse object can be used to specify a hit area for displayObjects

params.name: x
params.description: The X coord of the upper-left corner of the framing rectangle of this ellipse

params.name: y
params.description: The Y coord of the upper-left corner of the framing rectangle of this ellipse

params.name: width
params.description: The overall width of this ellipse

params.name: height
params.description: The overall height of this ellipse

Point.name: Point
Point.description: The Point object represents a location in a two-dimensional coordinate system, where x represents the horizontal axis and y represents the vertical axis.

params.name: x
params.description: position of the point

params.name: y
params.description: position of the point

params.name: points
params.description:
This can be an array of Points that form the polygon,
     a flat array of numbers that will be interpreted as [x,y, x,y, ...], or the arguments passed can be
     all the points of the polygon e.g. `new PIXI.Polygon(new PIXI.Point(), new PIXI.Point(), ...)`, or the
     arguments passed can be flat x,y values e.g. `new PIXI.Polygon(x,y, x,y, x,y, ...)` where `x` and `y` are
     Numbers.

Rectangle.name: Rectangle
Rectangle.description: the Rectangle object is an area defined by its position, as indicated by its top-left corner point (x, y) and by its width and its height.

params.name: x
params.description: The X coord of the upper-left corner of the rectangle

params.name: y
params.description: The Y coord of the upper-left corner of the rectangle

params.name: width
params.description: The overall width of this rectangle

params.name: height
params.description: The overall height of this rectangle

DisplayObject.name: DisplayObject
DisplayObject.description: The base class for all objects that are rendered on the screen.

DisplayObjectContainer.name: DisplayObjectContainer
DisplayObjectContainer.description:
A DisplayObjectContainer represents a collection of display objects.
It is the base class of all display objects that act as a container for other objects.

MovieClip.name: MovieClip
MovieClip.description: A MovieClip is a simple way to display an animation depicted by a list of textures.

params.name: textures
params.description: an array of {Texture} objects that make up the animation

Sprite.name: Sprite
Sprite.description: The Sprite object is the base for all textured objects that are rendered to the screen

params.name: texture
params.description: The texture for this sprite

Stage.name: Stage
Stage.description: A Stage represents the root of the display tree. Everything connected to the stage is rendered

params.name: backgroundColor
params.description:
the background color of the stage, easiest way to pass this in is in hex format
     like: 0xFFFFFF for white

Spine.name: Spine
Spine.description:
The Spine loader is used to load in JSON spine data
To generate the data you need to use http://esotericsoftware.com/ and export in the "JSON" format
Due to a clash of names  You will need to change the extension of the spine file from *.json to *.anim for it to load
See example 12 (http://www.goodboydigital.com/pixijs/examples/12/) to see a working example and check out the source
You will need to generate a sprite sheet to accompany the spine data
When loaded this class will dispatch a "loaded" event

params.name: url
params.description: The url of the spine anim file to be used

TilingSprite.name: TilingSprite
TilingSprite.description: A tiling sprite is a fast way of rendering a tiling image

params.name: texture
params.description: the texture of the tiling sprite

params.name: width
params.description: the width of the tiling sprite

params.name: height
params.description: the height of the tiling sprite

AbstractFilter.name: AbstractFilter
AbstractFilter.description:
This is the base class for creating a pixi.js filter. Currently only webGL supports filters.
If you want to make a custom filter this should be your base class.

AlphaMaskFilter.name: AlphaMaskFilter
AlphaMaskFilter.description:
The AlphaMaskFilter class uses the pixel values from the specified texture (called the displacement map) to perform a displacement of an object.
 You can use this filter to apply all manor of crazy warping effects
 Currently the r property of the texture is used offset the x and the g propery of the texture is used to offset the y.

params.name: texture
params.description: The texture used for the displacemtent map * must be power of 2 texture at the moment

BlurFilter.name: BlurFilter
BlurFilter.description:
The BlurFilter applies a Gaussian blur to an object.
 The strength of the blur can be set for x- and y-axis separately (always relative to the stage).

ColorMatrixFilter.name: ColorMatrixFilter
ColorMatrixFilter.description:
The ColorMatrixFilter class lets you apply a 4x4 matrix transformation on the RGBA
 color and alpha values of every pixel on your displayObject to produce a result
 with a new set of RGBA color and alpha values. Its pretty powerful!

ColorStepFilter.name: ColorStepFilter
ColorStepFilter.description: This lowers the color depth of your image by the given amount, producing an image with a smaller palette.

DisplacementFilter.name: DisplacementFilter
DisplacementFilter.description:
The DisplacementFilter class uses the pixel values from the specified texture (called the displacement map) to perform a displacement of an object.
 You can use this filter to apply all manor of crazy warping effects
 Currently the r property of the texture is used offset the x and the g propery of the texture is used to offset the y.

params.name: texture
params.description: The texture used for the displacemtent map * must be power of 2 texture at the moment

DotScreenFilter.name: DotScreenFilter
DotScreenFilter.description: This filter applies a dotscreen effect making display objects appear to be made out of black and white halftone dots like an old printer

GrayFilter.name: GrayFilter
GrayFilter.description: This turns your displayObjects to black and white.

PixelateFilter.name: PixelateFilter
PixelateFilter.description: This filter applies a pixelate effect making display objects appear 'blocky'

SepiaFilter.name: SepiaFilter
SepiaFilter.description: This applies a sepia effect to your displayObjects.

TwistFilter.name: TwistFilter
TwistFilter.description: This filter applies a twist effect making display objects appear twisted in the given direction

AssetLoader.name: AssetLoader
AssetLoader.description:
A Class that loads a bunch of images / sprite sheet / bitmap font files. Once the
assets have been loaded they are added to the PIXI Texture cache and can be accessed
easily through PIXI.Texture.fromImage() and PIXI.Sprite.fromImage()
When all items have been loaded this class will dispatch a 'onLoaded' event
As each individual item is loaded this class will dispatch a 'onProgress' event

params.name: assetURLs
params.description:
an array of image/sprite sheet urls that you would like loaded
     supported. Supported image formats include 'jpeg', 'jpg', 'png', 'gif'. Supported
     sprite sheet data formats only include 'JSON' at this time. Supported bitmap font
     data formats include 'xml' and 'fnt'.

params.name: crossorigin
params.description: Whether requests should be treated as crossorigin

AtlasLoader.name: AtlasLoader
AtlasLoader.description:
The atlas file loader is used to load in Atlas data and parse it
When loaded this class will dispatch a 'loaded' event
If loading fails this class will dispatch an 'error' event

params.name: url
params.description: the url of the JSON file

BitmapFontLoader.name: BitmapFontLoader
BitmapFontLoader.description:
The xml loader is used to load in XML bitmap font data ('xml' or 'fnt')
To generate the data you can use http://www.angelcode.com/products/bmfont/
This loader will also load the image file as the data.
When loaded this class will dispatch a 'loaded' event

params.name: url
params.description: The url of the sprite sheet JSON file

params.name: crossorigin
params.description: Whether requests should be treated as crossorigin

ImageLoader.name: ImageLoader
ImageLoader.description:
The image loader class is responsible for loading images file formats ('jpeg', 'jpg', 'png' and 'gif')
Once the image has been loaded it is stored in the PIXI texture cache and can be accessed though PIXI.Texture.fromFrameId() and PIXI.Sprite.fromFrameId()
When loaded this class will dispatch a 'loaded' event

params.name: url
params.description: The url of the image

params.name: crossorigin
params.description: Whether requests should be treated as crossorigin

JsonLoader.name: JsonLoader
JsonLoader.description:
The json file loader is used to load in JSON data and parse it
When loaded this class will dispatch a 'loaded' event
If loading fails this class will dispatch an 'error' event

params.name: url
params.description: The url of the JSON file

params.name: crossorigin
params.description: Whether requests should be treated as crossorigin

SpriteSheetLoader.name: SpriteSheetLoader
SpriteSheetLoader.description:
The sprite sheet loader is used to load in JSON sprite sheet data
To generate the data you can use http://www.codeandweb.com/texturepacker and publish in the 'JSON' format
There is a free version so thats nice, although the paid version is great value for money.
It is highly recommended to use Sprite sheets (also know as a 'texture atlas') as it means sprites can be batched and drawn together for highly increased rendering speed.
Once the data has been loaded the frames are stored in the PIXI texture cache and can be accessed though PIXI.Texture.fromFrameId() and PIXI.Sprite.fromFrameId()
This loader will load the image file that the Spritesheet points to as well as the data.
When loaded this class will dispatch a 'loaded' event

params.name: url
params.description: The url of the sprite sheet JSON file

params.name: crossorigin
params.description: Whether requests should be treated as crossorigin

Graphics.name: Graphics
Graphics.description:
The Graphics class contains a set of methods that you can use to create primitive shapes and lines.
It is important to know that with the webGL renderer only simple polys can be filled at this stage
Complex polys will not be filled. Heres an example of a complex poly: http://www.goodboydigital.com/wp-content/uploads/2013/06/complexPolygon.png

CanvasGraphics.name: CanvasGraphics
CanvasGraphics.description: A set of functions used by the webGL renderer to draw the primitive graphics data

CanvasRenderer.name: CanvasRenderer
CanvasRenderer.description:
the CanvasRenderer draws the stage and all its content onto a 2d canvas. This renderer should be used for browsers that do not support webGL.
Dont forget to add the view to your DOM or you will not see anything :)

params.name: width=0
params.description: the width of the canvas view

params.name: height=0
params.description: the height of the canvas view

params.name: view
params.description: the canvas to use as a view, optional

params.name: transparent=false
params.description: the transparency of the render view, default false

WebGLRenderer.name: WebGLRenderer
WebGLRenderer.description:
the WebGLRenderer draws the stage and all its content onto a webGL enabled canvas. This renderer
should be used for browsers that support webGL. This Render works by automatically managing webGLBatch's.
So no need for Sprite Batch's or Sprite Cloud's
Dont forget to add the view to your DOM or you will not see anything :)

params.name: width=0
params.description: the width of the canvas view

params.name: height=0
params.description: the height of the canvas view

params.name: view
params.description: the canvas to use as a view, optional

params.name: transparent=false
params.description: If the render view is transparent, default false

params.name: antialias=false
params.description: sets antialias (only applicable in chrome at the moment)

BitmapText.name: BitmapText
BitmapText.description:
A Text Object will create a line(s) of text using bitmap font. To split a line you can use '\n', '\r' or '\r\n'
You can generate the fnt files using
http://www.angelcode.com/products/bmfont/ for windows or
http://www.bmglyph.com/ for mac.

params.name: text
params.description: The copy that you would like the text to display

params.name: style
params.description: The style parameters

props.name: font
props.description: The size (optional) and bitmap font id (required) eq 'Arial' or '20px Arial' (must have loaded previously)

props.name: align
props.description: Alignment for multiline text ('left', 'center' or 'right'), does not affect single line text

Text.name: Text
Text.description: A Text Object will create a line(s) of text. To split a line you can use '\n'

params.name: text
params.description: The copy that you would like the text to display

params.name: style
params.description: The style parameters

props.name: font
props.description: default 'bold 20pt Arial' The style and size of the font

props.name: fill
props.description: A canvas fillstyle that will be used on the text eg 'red', '#00FF00'

props.name: align
props.description: Alignment for multiline text ('left', 'center' or 'right'), does not affect single line text

props.name: stroke
props.description: A canvas fillstyle that will be used on the text stroke eg 'blue', '#FCFF00'

props.name: strokeThickness
props.description: A number that represents the thickness of the stroke. Default is 0 (no stroke)

props.name: wordWrap
props.description: Indicates if word wrap should be used

props.name: wordWrapWidth
props.description: The width at which text will wrap

BaseTexture.name: BaseTexture
BaseTexture.description: A texture stores the information that represents an image. All textures have a base texture

params.name: source
params.description: the source object (image or canvas)

RenderTexture.name: RenderTexture

params.name: width
params.description: The width of the render texture

params.name: height
params.description: The height of the render texture

Texture.name: Texture
Texture.description:
A texture stores the information that represents an image or part of an image. It cannot be added
to the display list directly. To do this use PIXI.Sprite. If no frame is provided then the whole image is used

params.name: baseTexture
params.description: The base texture source to create the texture from

params.name: frame
params.description: The rectangle frame of the texture to show

EventTarget.name: EventTarget
EventTarget.description: Adds event emitter functionality to a class

PolyK._PointInTriangle.name: PolyK._PointInTriangle
PolyK._PointInTriangle.description: Checks if a point is within a triangle

PolyK._convex.name: PolyK._convex
PolyK._convex.description: Checks if a shape is convex

PolyK.AjaxRequest.name: PolyK.AjaxRequest
PolyK.AjaxRequest.description: A wrapper for ajax requests to be handled cross browser

PolyK.InteractionManager.name: PolyK.InteractionManager
PolyK.InteractionManager.description:
The interaction manager deals with mouse and touch events. Any DisplayObject can be interactive
This manager also supports multitouch.

params.name: stage
params.description: The stage to handle interactions

PolyK.InteractionData.name: PolyK.InteractionData
PolyK.InteractionData.description: Holds all information related to an Interaction event

classitems.description: The coordinate of the object relative to the local coordinates of the parent.
classitems.name: position

classitems.description: The scale factor of the object.
classitems.name: scale

classitems.description: The pivot point of the displayObject that it rotates around
classitems.name: pivot

classitems.description: The rotation of the object in radians.
classitems.name: rotation

classitems.description: The opacity of the object.
classitems.name: alpha

classitems.description: The visibility of the object.
classitems.name: visible

classitems.description:
This is the defined area that will pick up mouse / touch events. It is null by default.
Setting it is a neat way of optimising the hitTest function that the interactionManager will use (as it will not need to hit test all the children)
classitems.name: hitArea

classitems.description: This is used to indicate if the displayObject should display a mouse hand cursor on rollover
classitems.name: buttonMode

classitems.description: Can this object be rendered
classitems.name: renderable

classitems.description: [read-only] The display object container that contains this display object.
classitems.name: parent

classitems.description: [read-only] The stage the display object is connected to, or undefined if it is not connected to the stage.
classitems.name: stage

classitems.description: [read-only] The multiplied alpha of the displayObject
classitems.name: worldAlpha

classitems.description: [read-only] Whether or not the object is interactive, do not toggle directly! use the `interactive` property
classitems.name: _interactive

classitems.description: This is the cursor that will be used when the mouse is over this object. To enable this the element must have interaction = true and buttonMode = true
classitems.name: defaultCursor

classitems.description: [read-only] Current transform of the object based on world (parent) factors
classitems.name: worldTransform

classitems.description: [read-only] Current transform of the object locally
classitems.name: localTransform

classitems.description: [NYI] Unknown
classitems.name: color

classitems.description: [NYI] Holds whether or not this object is dynamic, for rendering optimization
classitems.name: dynamic

classitems.description: A callback that is used when the users clicks on the displayObject with their mouse
classitems.name: click

classitems.description: A callback that is used when the user clicks the mouse down over the sprite
classitems.name: mousedown

classitems.description:
A callback that is used when the user releases the mouse that was over the displayObject
for this callback to be fired the mouse must have been pressed down over the displayObject
classitems.name: mouseup

classitems.description:
A callback that is used when the user releases the mouse that was over the displayObject but is no longer over the displayObject
for this callback to be fired, The touch must have started over the displayObject
classitems.name: mouseupoutside

classitems.description: A callback that is used when the users mouse rolls over the displayObject
classitems.name: mouseover

classitems.description: A callback that is used when the users mouse leaves the displayObject
classitems.name: mouseout

classitems.description:
A callback that is used when the users taps on the sprite with their finger
basically a touch version of click
classitems.name: tap

classitems.description: A callback that is used when the user touches over the displayObject
classitems.name: touchstart

classitems.description: A callback that is used when the user releases a touch over the displayObject
classitems.name: touchend

classitems.description:
A callback that is used when the user releases the touch that was over the displayObject
for this callback to be fired, The touch must have started over the sprite
classitems.name: touchendoutside

classitems.description:
[Deprecated] Indicates if the sprite will have touch and mouse interactivity. It is false by default
Instead of using this function you can now simply set the interactive property to true or false
classitems.name: setInteractive

classitems.description: Indicates if the sprite will have touch and mouse interactivity. It is false by default
classitems.name: interactive

classitems.description: [read-only] Indicates if the sprite is globaly visible.
classitems.name: worldVisible

classitems.description:
Sets a mask for the displayObject. A mask is an object that limits the visibility of an object to the shape of the mask applied to it.
In PIXI a regular mask must be a PIXI.Graphics object. This allows for much faster masking in canvas as it utilises shape clipping.
To remove a mask, set this property to null.
classitems.name: mask

classitems.description:
Sets the filters for the displayObject.
* IMPORTANT: This is a webGL only feature and will be ignored by the canvas renderer.
To remove filters simply set this property to 'null'
classitems.name: filters

classitems.description: [read-only] The of children of this container.
classitems.name: children

classitems.description: The width of the displayObjectContainer, setting this will actually modify the scale to achieve the value set
classitems.name: width

classitems.description: The height of the displayObjectContainer, setting this will actually modify the scale to achieve the value set
classitems.name: height

classitems.description: Adds a child to the container.
classitems.name: addChild

params.name: child
params.description: The DisplayObject to add to the container

classitems.description: Adds a child to the container at a specified index. If the index is out of bounds an error will be thrown
classitems.name: addChildAt

params.name: child
params.description: The child to add

params.name: index
params.description: The index to place the child in

classitems.description: [NYI] Swaps the depth of 2 displayObjects
classitems.name: swapChildren

classitems.description: Returns the child at the specified index
classitems.name: getChildAt

params.name: index
params.description: The index to get the child from

classitems.description: Removes a child from the container.
classitems.name: removeChild

params.name: child
params.description: The DisplayObject to remove

classitems.description: The array of textures that make up the animation

classitems.description:
[read-only] totalFrames is the total number of frames in the MovieClip. This is the same as number of textures
assigned to the MovieClip.

params.name: frameNumber

classitems.description: Goes to a specific frame and begins playing the MovieClip

classitems.description:
The anchor sets the origin point of the texture.
The default is 0,0 this means the textures origin is the top left
Setting than anchor to 0.5,0.5 means the textures origin is centered
Setting the anchor to 1,1 would mean the textures origin points will be the bottom right
classitems.name: anchor

classitems.description: The texture that the sprite is using
classitems.name: texture

classitems.description: The width of the sprite (this is initially set by the texture)

classitems.description: The height of the sprite (this is initially set by the texture)
classitems.name: _height

classitems.description: The tint applied to the sprite. This is a hex value
classitems.name: tint

classitems.name: blendMode

classitems.description: The width of the sprite, setting this will actually modify the scale to achieve the value set
classitems.name: width

classitems.description: The height of the sprite, setting this will actually modify the scale to achieve the value set
classitems.name: height

classitems.description: Sets the texture of the sprite
classitems.name: setTexture

params.name: texture
params.description: The PIXI texture that is displayed by the sprite

classitems.description: When the texture is updated, this event will fire to update the scale and frame
classitems.name: onTextureUpdate

classitems.description:
Helper function that creates a sprite that will contain a texture from the TextureCache based on the frameId
 The frame ids are created when a Texture packer file has been loaded
classitems.name: fromFrame

params.name: frameId
params.description: The frame Id of the texture in the cache

return.description: A new Sprite using a texture from the texture cache matching the frameId

classitems.description:
Helper function that creates a sprite that will contain a texture based on an image url
 If the image is not in the texture cache it will be loaded
classitems.name: fromImage

params.name: imageId
params.description: The image url of the texture

return.description: A new Sprite using a texture from the texture cache matching the image id

classitems.description: [read-only] Current transform of the object based on world (parent) factors
classitems.name: worldTransform

classitems.description: Whether or not the stage is interactive
classitems.name: interactive

classitems.description: The interaction manage for this stage, manages all interactive activity on the stage
classitems.name: interactive

classitems.description: Whether the stage is dirty and needs to have interactions updated
classitems.name: dirty

classitems.description:
Sets another DOM element which can receive mouse/touch interactions instead of the default Canvas element.
This is useful for when you have other DOM elements on top of the Canvas element.
classitems.name: setInteractionDelegate

params.name: domElement
params.description: This new domElement which will receive mouse/touch events

classitems.description: Sets the background color for the stage
classitems.name: setBackgroundColor

params.name: backgroundColor
params.description:
the color of the background, easiest way to pass this in is in hex format
     like: 0xFFFFFF for white

classitems.description: This will return the point containing global coords of the mouse.
classitems.name: getMousePosition

return.description: The point containing the coords of the global InteractionData position.

classitems.author:
Mat Groves http://matgroves.com/ @Doormat23
based on pixi impact spine implementation made by Eemeli Kelokorpi (@ekelokorpi) https://github.com/ekelokorpi

Awesome JS run time provided by EsotericSoftware
https://github.com/EsotericSoftware/spine-runtimes

classitems.description: cx1 and cx2 are from 0 to 1, representing the percent of time between the two keyframes. cy1 and cy2 are the percent of
from the new skin are attached if the corresponding attachment from the old skin was attached.
The scaling of the image that is being tiled
classitems.name: tileScale

classitems.description: The offset position of the image that is being tiled
classitems.name: tilePosition

classitems.description: The width of the sprite, setting this will actually modify the scale to achieve the value set
classitems.name: width

classitems.description: The height of the TilingSprite, setting this will actually modify the scale to achieve the value set
classitems.name: height

classitems.description:
An array of passes - some filters contain a few steps this array simply stores the steps in a liniear fashion.
For example the blur filter has two passes blurX and blurY.
classitems.name: passes
classitems.type: Array an array of filter objects

classitems.description: The texture used for the displacemtent map * must be power of 2 texture at the moment
classitems.name: map

classitems.description: Sets the strength of both the blurX and blurY properties simultaneously
classitems.name: blur
classitems.type: Number the strength of the blur

classitems.description: Sets the strength of the blurX property
classitems.name: blurX
classitems.type: Number the strength of the blurX

classitems.description: Sets the strength of the blurX property
classitems.name: blurY
classitems.type: Number the strength of the blurY

classitems.description: Sets the matrix of the color matrix filter
classitems.name: matrix

classitems.description: The number of steps.
classitems.name: step

classitems.description: The texture used for the displacemtent map * must be power of 2 texture at the moment
classitems.name: map

classitems.description: The multiplier used to scale the displacement result from the map calculation.
classitems.name: scale

classitems.description: The offset used to move the displacement map.
classitems.name: offset

classitems.description: This describes the the scale
classitems.name: scale

classitems.description:
If cacheAsBitmap is true the graphics object will then be rendered as if it was a sprite.
This is useful if your graphics element does not change often as it will speed up the rendering of the object
It is also usful as the graphics object will always be antialiased because it will be rendered using canvas
Not recommended if you are constanly redrawing the graphics element.
classitems.name: cacheAsBitmap

classitems.description: Specifies a line style used for subsequent calls to Graphics methods such as the lineTo() method or the drawCircle() method.

props.name: fill
props.description: A canvas fillstyle that will be used on the text eg 'red', '#00FF00'

props.name: align
props.description: Alignment for multiline text ('left', 'center' or 'right'), does not affect single line text

props.name: stroke
props.description: A canvas fillstyle that will be used on the text stroke eg 'blue', '#FCFF00'

props.name: strokeThickness
props.description: A number that represents the thickness of the stroke. Default is 0 (no stroke)

props.name: wordWrap
props.description: Indicates if word wrap should be used

props.name: wordWrapWidth
props.description: The width at which text will wrap

classitems.description:
This helper function will automatically detect which renderer you should be using.
WebGL is the preferred renderer as it is a lot faster. If webGL is not supported by
the browser then this function will return a canvas renderer

params.description: the canvas to use as a view, optional

params.name: transparent=false
params.description: the transparency of the render view, default false

params.name: antialias=false
params.description:
sets antialias (only applicable in webGL chrome at the moment)

antialias
